  • Element
org.keyboardplaying.mapper.annotation

Annotation Type Metadata


  • @Documented
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface Metadata
    This annotation marks a field that should be mapped between map and bean. It should be used to map the bean's field with the name of its counterpart in the map as a value.
    Author:
    Cyrille Chopelet (http://keyboardplaying.org)

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean blankDefaultMetadata
      If true and not defaultMetadata() is provided, an empty string will be used instead.
      boolean blankDefaultValue
      If true and not defaultValue() is provided, an empty string will be used instead.
      String defaultMetadata
      Defines the default value to use when mapping metadata if this target is null.
      String defaultValue
      Defines the default value to use when unmapping metadata if this metadata does not have a value for the key for this target.
      Class<? extends ElaborateParser<?>> elaborate
      Defines the ElaborateParser to use when the parsing requires some logic.
      boolean mandatory
      Defines whether a field is mandatory.
      String value
      Returns the key for the value in the map which should be used when setting this field.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract String value
        Returns the key for the value in the map which should be used when setting this field.
        Returns:
        the key for this field's value in the metadata map
        Default:
        ""

      • mandatory

        public abstract boolean mandatory
        Defines whether a field is mandatory.

        If the field is mandatory but missing when mapping (or missing in the map when unmapping), an exception will be thrown.

        Returns:
        true if this field is mandatory, false otherwise
        Default:
        false

      • defaultValue

        public abstract String defaultValue
        Defines the default value to use when unmapping metadata if this metadata does not have a value for the key for this target.

        The same parser will be used as if the data came from the metadata map.

        This attribute does not work if you want an empty string as default. In this case, please see blankDefaultValue().

        Returns:
        the default value when unmapping the annotated target
        Default:
        ""

      • blankDefaultValue

        public abstract boolean blankDefaultValue
        If true and not defaultValue() is provided, an empty string will be used instead.
        Returns:
        true if an empty string should be used as defaultValue()
        Default:
        false

      • defaultMetadata

        public abstract String defaultMetadata
        Defines the default value to use when mapping metadata if this target is null.

        The value will be inserted into the metadata map as is.

        This attribute does not work if you want an empty string as default. In this case, please see blankDefaultMetadata().

        Returns:
        the default value when unmapping the annotated target
        Default:
        ""

      • blankDefaultMetadata

        public abstract boolean blankDefaultMetadata
        If true and not defaultMetadata() is provided, an empty string will be used instead.
        Returns:
        true if an empty string should be used as defaultMetadata()
        Default:
        false

      • elaborate

        public abstract Class<? extends ElaborateParser<?>> elaborate
        Defines the ElaborateParser to use when the parsing requires some logic.
        Returns:
        the ElaborateParser
        Default:
        org.keyboardplaying.mapper.parser.ElaborateParser.None.class
